frontmatter.title: Manage Pages
frontmatter.description: Learn how to create, navigate, and manage pages in Adobe Express documents.

questions.question: How do I add a page programmatically?
questions.answer: Use `editor.documentRoot.pages.addPage()` method with page dimensions. There is no `createPage()` method.

questions.question: Why doesn't createPage() work?
questions.answer: The Document API uses `editor.documentRoot.pages.addPage()` for pages, not `createPage()`. Use `editor.documentRoot.pages.addPage(dimensions)` instead.

questions.question: How do I get the current page?
questions.answer: Use `editor.context.currentPage` to access the currently active page.

questions.question: How do I navigate between pages?
questions.answer: Adding a page automatically switches to it. You can also access pages via `editor.documentRoot.pages`.

questions.question: What happens when I add a page?
questions.answer: A new page with a default artboard is created and automatically becomes the active page and insertion parent.

questions.question: Can I remove pages?
questions.answer: Currently, the Document API doesn't provide a direct method to remove pages programmatically.

questions.question: How do I access all pages in a document?
questions.answer: Use `editor.documentRoot.pages` to access the PageList containing all pages.

questions.question: What are the minimum requirements for a page?
questions.answer: Every page must have at least one artboard. The `editor.documentRoot.pages.addPage()` method automatically creates a default artboard.
